text:
“I killed her,” he said, breathless. “It was atonement for my sins.”  
Dounia gasped, “Brother, what are you saying? You shed blood!”  
“Which all men shed,” he replied frantically. “It flows like champagne.  
I wanted to do good. I thought I could make up for it.”  
“Do you hear yourself?” she cried, despair in her voice.  
“I’m contemptible,” he said, his eyes wild. “I failed. I’m trapped.”  
“Not so, brother! Not so!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist grapples with the moral implications of his actions, justifying his crime as a misguided attempt to achieve a greater good while confronting his own cowardice and contemptibility.
